Revenue is the total amount of money payable to a business from the sale of its product
This differs from profit.


## Different Types of Revenue

- **Total revenue** is the total value of all sales a firm incurs
	- aggregate amount of money a firm receives from selling goods and services
![[02_areas/ECON/03Microeconomic Decision Makers/22/attachments/ba57b53efa727f91a27c70c16806d4d3_MD5.jpeg]]
    
- **Average revenue** is the overall revenue per unit
	- typical price received from the sale of a good or service
	- sometimes products are differently prices or discounts
![[02_areas/ECON/03Microeconomic Decision Makers/22/attachments/711b055c59858ba7fb756c7081aa6bda_MD5.jpeg]]

**An Example of Revenue Calculations**

- **Average revenue** information is especially useful to a firm **selling multiple products** (e.g. supermarkets) or a firm that sells the **same item at different prices** (e.g. rail tickets are usually priced differently for different types of commuters e.g. pensioners)
